{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox concert tour | concert_tour_name = Little Britain Live | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | image_caption = | artist = [[David Walliams]] and [[Matt Lucas (comedian)|Matt Lucas]] | location = | type = | album = | start_date = {{Start date|2005|10|24|df=yes}} | end_date = {{End date|2007|03|09|df=yes}} | number_of_legs = 2 | number_of_shows = 211 in UK & Ireland
32 in Australia
243 Total | Misc = }} '''''Little Britain Live''''' is a stage show based on the TV sketch series ''[[Little Britain]]'', performed by its stars, [[Matt Lucas (comedian)|Matt Lucas]] and [[David Walliams]], and directed by [[Jeremy Sams]]. Supporting characters are played by [[Paul Putner]] and Samantha Power (with [[Anthony Head]] and [[Ruth Jones]] in certain performances). As in the TV show, [[Tom Baker]] is the narrator, although his lines are pre-recorded. The show toured the United Kingdom from October 2005 until December 2006, and Australia from January–March 2007. ==Development== In an interview in the show's program, Lucas and Walliams state that they had always wanted ''Little Britain'' to be a radio programme, a television series and live stage show. After production of the third series of the television show, the duo settled down to write and plan the show. In rehearsals, the sketches were tweaked, re-ordered and re-written in order to accommodate the rapid costume and make-up changes required by the principal performers. To remove the need for stagehands to make set and prop changes, an elaborate stage floor was designed with track lines for the props. Sets were projected onto the background of the stage, with computer animated transitions designed by video and lighting designer [[Willie Williams (lighting designer)|Willie Williams]].''Little Britain Live'' programme Certain sketches required elaborate technical mechanisms, such as the vomit machine for the Judy and Maggie "Village Fete" sketch, and oversized props for the [[Dennis Waterman (Little Britain)|Dennis Waterman]] sketch. During the show's UK run, several sketches were rewritten to improve the pacing, or removed in cases where the sketch was the same as the TV series. ==Performances== The show's run began at the [[Portsmouth Guildhall]] in [[Portsmouth]], [[Hampshire]] on 23 October 2005. The show toured for 49 performances in 18 cities: [[Bournemouth]], [[Southend]], [[Plymouth]], [[Sheffield]], [[Manchester]], [[Nottingham]], [[Glasgow]], [[Edinburgh]], [[Newcastle upon Tyne|Newcastle]], [[Liverpool]], [[Oxford]], [[Bristol]], [[Ipswich]], [[Birmingham]], [[Blackpool]], [[Brighton]] and ending in [[Manchester]] on 20 December. Lucas and Walliams took a month off, before resuming the UK tour and returning to the previously-toured cities. A month-long residency at the [[Hammersmith Apollo]] in London in October and November 2006 followed, with two shows at the [[Brixton Academy]].[http://www.davidwalliams.com/LittleBritainTour2005.htm Little Britain Tour 2005], DavidWalliams.com. There were 3 live shows in Ireland during the summer of 2006, shown at the [[Point Theatre]] in Dublin. The show was eventually seen by nearly one million people on its UK tour from November 2005 to December 2006.[http://news.independent.co.uk/people/profiles/article2114991.ece Matt Lucas: Littler Britain], ''[[The Independent]]'', 1 January 2007. ''Little Britain Live'' toured Australia in early 2007. Initial bookings were made in Sydney, with other cities added as ticket sales soared. Eventually the show sold out six performances in [[Melbourne]] and [[Brisbane]], seven in [[Sydney]] and [[Perth]], and two in [[Adelaide]]. Performances were also held in [[Canberra]], [[Newcastle, New South Wales|Newcastle]] and [[Wollongong, New South Wales|Wollongong]]. ==Show order== ===Act 1=== * Lou and Andy – "Welcome" * Emily and Florence – "Plumber" * Carol Beer – "Disneyworld" * Dudley and Ting Tong – "Dudley in Hospital" * Kenny Craig- "Engagement Ring" * Ray McCooney – "Paying the Bill" * Vicky Pollard – "Assembly" * Des Kaye – "Hide the Sausage" * Judy and Maggie – "Village Fete" ===Act 2=== * Anne – "Stars in Their Eyes" – "Whitney Houston's The Greatest Love of All" (guest star Natalie Brown) * Bubbles – "Bank" * Sir Norman Fry – "Press Statement" * Mr Mann – "Roy's Paint Shop" * Linda – "Chewbacca", "Blind Dave", "Fiddler on the Roof" * Dennis Waterman – "Celebrity Big Brother" * Marjorie Dawes- "Game for New Members", "Audience Weigh-in" * Mrs Emery – "Greengrocer" * Sebastian and Michael – "Separation" ===Encore=== * Daffyd Thomas – "I'm Gay" song ===Variations=== [[Anthony Head]] (as the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]]) and [[Ruth Jones]] (as barmaid Myfanwy) reprised their roles for certain performances, also appearing as backup dancers during Daffyd's song. Head appeared in three performances in Birmingham (5–6 May, 9 December), two in Blackpool (8–9 May), during the show's London run, Cardiff (7 December), Melbourne (30 January – 2 February) and Sydney (3–5 February). Jones appeared in Blackpool (and hence on the DVD), Cardiff, and during the London run.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/london/content/articles/2006/10/03/theatre_octdiary_pt1_feature.shtml Shows you shouldn't miss], [[bbc.co.uk]], October 2006. A special version of the stage show featuring several celebrity guests was performed at the Hammersmith Apollo in London on 22 November 2006, and was shown by the BBC on 16 March 2007 as part of [[Comic Relief (charity)|Comic Relief]]. Celebrity performers included [[Kate Moss]] as Vicky Pollard's sister Katie, [[Dawn French]] as lesbian barmaid Myfanwy, and the real [[Dennis Waterman]] who appeared to sing the ''[[Minder (TV series)|Minder]]'' "feem toon" with his [[Dennis Waterman (Little Britain)|pint-sized counterpart]]. The show also featured cameo appearances from [[Russell Brand]], [[Patsy Kensit]], [[Kate Thornton]] and DJ [[Chris Moyles]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6175608.stm Model Moss joins Little Britain], ''[[BBC News]]'', 23 November 2006. Several sketches are adjusted to reflect local content, such as the locality referred to as a 'shithole' by travel agent Carol Beer ([[Preston, Lancashire|Preston]] in Blackpool, [[Bolton]] in Manchester,[http://www.littlebritainonline.com/?go=tourreview Little Britain Live tour review], Little Britain Online, 12 November 2006. [[Wolverhampton]] or [[Chelmsley Wood]] in Birmingham, [[Derby]] in Nottingham, [[Strabane]] in Belfast, Shepherd's Bush in London, [[Broadmeadows, Victoria|Broadmeadows]] in Melbourne, [[Elizabeth, South Australia|Elizabeth]] in Adelaide, [[Balga, Western Australia|Balga]] in Perth, [[Ipswich, Queensland|Ipswich]] in Brisbane, [[City of Sunderland|Sunderland]] in [[Tyne and Wear]], [[Dapto, New South Wales|Dapto]] in Wollongong and [[Charnwood, Australian Capital Territory|Charnwood]] in Canberra), or retail outlets frequented by Vicky Pollard. In Australia, Lucas and Walliams were assisted by local comedians such as [[Gina Riley]] and [[Jane Turner]] (creators of ''[[Kath & Kim (Australian TV series)|Kath & Kim]]'') for Melbourne references and [[Andrew Denton]] for Sydney.Adams, Cameron: [http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21145425-2902,00.html Look at moi, Britain], ''[[Herald Sun]]'', 31 January 2007. The Des Kaye and Marjorie Dawes sketches include audience participation, with members of the audience invited on-stage to take part in a game of 'Hide the Sausage' with Des, or participate in a 'weigh-in' with Marjorie. ==Tour dates== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:150px;"|Date ! style="width:150px;"|City ! style="width:150px;"|Country ! |Cardiff, Wales |Cardiff International Arena |Cancelled |- |28 November 2006 |Bournemouth, England |Windsor Hall |Rescheduled to 8 December 2006 |- |} ==Official releases== ===DVD=== [[Image:Lblivecover.jpg|100px|right]] The 9 May performance at the Blackpool Opera House was recorded and released on DVD in the UK ([[DVD region code#Region codes and countries|Region 2]]) and Australia ([[DVD region code#Region codes and countries|Region 4]]). The UK DVD was released on 13 November 2006 in a standard edition format and a special edition format (which included a miniature tour programme). Also included on the DVD released in Australia (6 December 2006) and in the UK was 'Little Britain's Big Swim' which featured David Walliams swimming the [[English Channel]]. ==="I'm Gay" single=== Daffyd Thomas's song "I'm Gay" was recorded in a studio and released as an Internet-only single on the UK and Australian [[iTunes Store]]s.[http://www.bucksmusicgroup.com/releases/index.html I'm Gay], Bucks Music Group. ==Comic Relief does Little Britain Live== This is a night of ''Little Britain Live'' with celebrity guests such as [[Kate Moss]] and [[Peter Kay]]. £3 from each DVD sale goes to [[Comic Relief (charity)|Comic Relief]]. A live ''Little Britain'' show was made for Comic Relief at the [[Hammersmith Apollo]] on 22 November 2006, and featured many guest artists and celebrities. This version was released in March 2007 and televised as part of ''Comic Relief: The Big One''. It was later included as a bonus feature on the ''Little Britain Abroad'' DVD. Guest artists included: *[[Kate Moss]] as Vicky Pollard's twin sister.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6175608.stm|title=Model Moss joins Little Britain|publisher=BBC|date=23 November 2006|accessdate=11 February 2007}} *[[Dawn French]] as Myfanwy in the Daffyd Thomas sketch. *[[Russell Brand]] as a [[cross-dressing]] plumber who comes out to "fellow cross dresser", Emily Howard. *[[Jonathan Ross (television presenter)|Jonathan Ross]] as the celebrity guest that Judy vomits on at the village fête. *[[Chris Moyles]] as an overweight victim of Marjorie's Fat Fighters club. *[[Dennis Waterman]] as himself, complaining about his portrayal in the Dennis Waterman sketch, then proceeds to sing the theme tune to ''[[Minder (TV series)|Minder]]''. *[[Peter Kay]] as wheelchair-using [[Brian Potter (character)|Brian Potter]]. *[[David Baddiel]] as a member of the audience brought onstage. *[[Jeremy Edwards]] as a molested contestant of Des Kaye's "Hide the Sausage" game *[[Patsy Kensit]] as a girl with hairy armpits who went to seek advice from [[Linda Flint]]. *[[Kate Thornton]] as the presenter of ''[[Stars in Their Eyes]]'', introducing Anne. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.coppel.com.au/artists/LittleBritain/LB_06.swf Official Australian Tour Website] {{Little Britain}} [[Category:Little Britain]] [[Category:Touring theatre]] [[Category:Comedy tours]]

revision.text:
{{primarysources|date=July 2010}} '''The Lytchett Karting League''' (established 2005) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[karting]] championship which primarily uses karting circuits in the South of England. The race format is usually two 15-minute timed sessions using the supplied karts at the chosen race venue.
==References== *[http://www.lytchettkarting.webs.com Lytchett Karting League website]
[[Category:Kart racing series]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox person |name=Krista Harrison |image=Krista Harrison.jpg |image_caption= School portrait of Krista Harrison |image_size= 180 |birth_name= Krista Lea Harrison |birth_date={{birth date|1971|05|28}} |birth_place= [[Orrville, Ohio|Orrville]], [[Ohio]], [[United States]] |death_date={{Death-date and age| July 17, 1982 | May 18, 1971}} |death_place= [[Marshallville, Ohio|Marshalville]], Ohio, United States |death_cause= Strangulation |body_discovered=July 23, 1982 |nationality= American |citizenship= United States |occupation= Student |known_for= Murder victim }} The '''murder of Krista Lea Harrison''' occurred on July 17, 1982, in [[Marshallville, Ohio]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Hone-McMahan|first=Kim|title=New family takes in broken child.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-144145718.html|accessdate=May 15, 2014|newspaper=Akron Beacon Journal|date=April 6, 2006}}{{subscription required}}</ref> The case remained unsolved for two years, until [[Robert Anthony Buell]] was convicted of her murder in 1984.<ref name=Prosecutor /> Harrison's case appeared on the [[Forensic Files (season 5)|fifth season]] of the American television show ''[[Forensic Files]]'' in an episode titled "Material Evidence."<ref>{{cite web|title=Forensic Files Episode Guide|url=http://answar7979.50megs.com/Episodeguide.htm|publisher=50megs.com|accessdate=May 18, 2012}}</ref>
== Abduction and Murder == [[File:Buell Sketch.jpg|left|thumb|Police sketches of the suspect at the time of Krista Harrison's abduction.]]
Eleven-year-old Krista Harrison <ref name=files>Monahan, Richard, dir. "Material Evidence." ''[[Forensic Files]]''. [[TLC (TV network)|TLC]], [[TruTV]]. October 31, 2000. Television.</ref><ref name=Renner>{{cite web|last=Renner|first=James|title=Krista Harrison|url=http://jamesrenner.wordpress.com/tag/krista-harrison/|publisher=Wordpress.com|accessdate=May 18, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20121210063624/http://jamesrenner.wordpress.com/tag/krista-harrison/|archivedate=December 10, 2012|df=}}</ref> (born May 28, 1971, [[Orrville, Ohio]])<ref name="Find A Grave">{{cite web|title=Krista Lea Harrison|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Harrison&GSfn=Krista&GSmn=Lea&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=29247296&df=all&|accessdate=May 22, 2012|publisher=[[Find A Grave]]|author= Gunn, Margaret}}</ref> had been picking up aluminum cans in the Marshallville park with one of her friends. The park was about one hundred yards from her home. It was reported by her friend that a man between 25 and 35 with shoulder-length hair drove up to Harrison in his van and forced her into the vehicle and drove away. Harrison's companion described the abductor's van to have been a brown or dark red color that had round windows on the sides, near the rear.<ref name=files /> After she was kidnapped, volunteers searched for her body across Marshallville to no avail. It was initially believed that the man would demand ransom for Krista's return, yet no contact was made.<ref name=vid>{{cite web|last=Renner|first=James|title=The Final Word on the Tragic Death of Krista Harrison|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=elfIzMihEsU|accessdate=March 17, 2014|date=November 4, 2011}}</ref>
It was not until six days later that her remains, which were in an advanced stage of decomposition, were discovered in the weeds a few feet off the side of a scarcely traveled road in adjacent Holmes County, Ohio. She had been strangled and sexually assaulted with a vibrator and a large plastic bag had been wrapped around her legs. Because of the condition of her remains, police were not able to identify the body until Harrison's father confirmed that it was his daughter. A [[Budweiser (Anheuser-Busch)|Budweiser]] towel, a bloody car seat box, a wad of Harrison's hair, gloves, a plaid shirt and jeans were all found in the vicinity of the dump site.<ref name=Prosecutor /><ref name=files /><ref name=Appeal>{{cite web|title=Robert Anthony Buell Appeal|url=http://www.michbar.org/opinions/us_appeals/2001/120401/13136.html|publisher=Michbar.org|accessdate=May 18, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020624124511/http://www.michbar.org/opinions/us_appeals/2001/120401/13136.html|archivedate=June 24, 2002|df=}}</ref> Examination of the remains indicated that the body was subjected to high temperatures, which was likely a consequence of her body remaining inside of the vehicle for a long period of time during summer weather.<ref name=files/> Harrison was buried in the Maple Grove Cemetery in Marshallville.<ref name="Find A Grave" />
==Investigation== [[File:Harmon fibers.jpg|thumb|Fibers found on Tina Harmon's body, which were similar to those on Harrison's body]]
On Harrison's body and the [[towel]] near the scene, a distinct number of nutmeg or orange-colored polyester fibers were found. After they were examined under a [[microscope]], investigators concluded that they were of trilobal shape and were likely from some type of carpet. Similar fibers were found on the body of [[Murder of Tina Harmon|Tina Harmon]], a 12-year-old girl who was raped and murdered eight months earlier. A man had already been convicted on circumstantial evidence in her death and was incarcerated when Harrison was abducted. Authorities then began to consider that both girls were victims of the same person, as they were both sexually violated, strangled, and killed in the same county. The two also had the same sort of fibers on their remains, further linking the crimes.<ref name=files/>
The bag found wrapped around the lower half of Harrison's body was unique, as it had distinct folding patterns and thickness that occurred during the manufacturing process. The bag was traced to a factory in [[Pioneer, Ohio]]. Such bags were used for packaging a type of car seat, which was black in color.<ref name=files/> These seats, sold through [[Sears]], were only available for a brief amount of time through mailing. The box containing Harrison's blood belonged to the same type of car seat. Sales records of the seats were subsequently examined from the store, to search for any Ohio resident who might purchased the seats. Twenty-three people in northern Ohio had purchased this type of car seat, but none owned a van that matched the one used during the abduction.<ref name=files/>
== Capture and trial of Robert Buell == {{quotebox|width=30%|align=left|quote="Jerry and Shirley, I didn't kill your daughter. The prosecutor knows that ... and they left the real killer out there on the streets to kill again and again and again." --Robert Anthony Buell's final words in 2002.<ref name=Disciple>{{cite web|publisher=[[Cleveland Scene]]|last=Renner, James|title=The Serial Killer's Disciple|url=https://www.clevescene.com/cleveland/ghosts-of-wayne-county/Content?oid=1534518}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Renner|first=James|title=Finding Amy's Killer|url=http://amymihaljevic.blogspot.com/2011_10_01_archive.html|accessdate=February 24, 2014}}</ref>}} After Harrison's body was found, a $10,000 reward was placed for information about the abductor, which showed composite sketches of the perpetrator. None was arrested until two years later.<ref name=files/> In 1984, 44-year-old [[Robert Anthony Buell]], employed by the state of Ohio, kidnapped a 28-year-old woman while she was working as a manager at an Ohio gas station in [[Damascus, Ohio]].<ref name=files /> The woman's head was shaved, she was shocked with a severed electrical cord, beaten and was bound to Buell's bed and raped. She was able to escape, twelve hours later, fearing for her life, and ran to a nearby house and notified police after her attacker had left to go to work.<ref name=Prosecutor>{{cite web|last=Clark Prosecuter.org|title=Robert Anthony Buell|url=http://www.clarkprosecutor.org/html/death/US/buell801.htm|accessdate=May 18, 2012}}</ref><ref name=files /> Such a man had previously preyed on Ohio women, who were usually in their late twenties to forties.<ref name=files/>
[[File:Robert Anthony Buell.jpg|thumb|Robert Anthony Buell in 2001]]
Police then compared the orange carpet fibers found on Harrison's body to the ones in Buell's van, which was the same color as the one seen in 1982. The rear-view windows were of a different shape, although it was later revealed that they had been replaced. It was later concluded that the fibers on Harrison's body and the carpet in the van were a likely match and records from Sears indicated that Buell had purchased the same type of car seat that was once contained in the bag and box used to conceal the body. Paint found on the jeans near the dump site matched that on the outside of Buell's residence as well. The jeans themselves were similar to other pairs that he owned. Spray paint in his garage was also matched to some that was present on the box.<ref name=files /> A fingerprint on plastic concealing Harrison's body did not.<ref name=Ghosts>{{cite news|last=Renner|first=James|title=Ghosts Of Wayne County Doubts Haunt An Old Murder And The Execution That Followed|url=http://www.clevescene.com/cleveland/ghosts-of-wayne-county/Content?oid=1534518|accessdate=February 24, 2014|newspaper=''Cleveland Scene''|date=December 30, 2008}}</ref>
Buell pleaded no contest to the abduction and rape of the adult victim, yet he denied any involvement with Krista's murder. He was found guilty after being tried and sentenced to death in 1984; he was executed by lethal injection in 2002.<ref name= Prosecutor /> He denied involvement and was never charged with the death of Tina Harmon, although dog hairs belonging to the remains of one found buried at his residence matched. In 2010, DNA compared from the crime scene of Tina's murder to Buell's matched, therefore indicating that he was involved in her rape and most likely, her murder.<ref name=vid /><ref name=Disciple/><ref name=Case>{{cite web|last=Renner|first=James|title=Case Closed!|url=http://www.clevelandindependent.com/2010/03/26/case-closed-2/|publisher=IndeOnline.com|accessdate=May 31, 2012|date=March 26, 2010}}</ref> Another victim who was murdered in 1983, Debora Kaye Smith, 10, had wax on her body that was from the same kind of candles that Buell owned. Her body was found over a month after her death, abandoned at the side of the [[Tuscarawas River]].<ref name=wants/>
Former journalist for the ''[[Cleveland Scene]]'' magazine, [[James Renner]], has written through several of his works that Buell's nephew, Ralph Ross Jr., may have played a role in the murders, if not having been fully responsible. He has also connected the cases to that of the unsolved murders of 13-year-old [[Murder of Barbara Barnes|Barbara Barnes]] and 10-year-old [[Murder of Amy Mihaljevic|Amy Mihaljevic]]. Similar fibers on the latter victim's body were found.<ref name=Renner /><ref name=wants>{{cite news|last1=Rink|first1=Matthew|title=Family of Tina Harmon, abducted and killed in 1981, wants police to reopen the case|url=http://www.indeonline.com/article/20081126/News/311269903|accessdate=August 5, 2014|agency=Indie Online|date=November 26, 2008}}</ref>

{{Infobox civil conflict | title = Nieuwmarkt riots | image = [[File:Rellen bij ontruiming panden in Nieuwmarktbuurt in Amsterdam waterkanon in acti, Bestanddeelnr 927-8239.jpg|300px]] | caption = Nieuwmarkt Riots on 24 March 1975 | date = 24 March 1975 - 8 April 1975 | place= [[Nieuwmarkt]], [[Amsterdam]], [[Netherlands]] | causes = Construction of the [[Amsterdam Metro]] | status = | goals = | result = Future plans for additional metro lines are abandoned | methods = Rioting, protests, barricades | side1= Local residents | side2= 100+ Municipal police officers
500 Military police officers | side3= | leadfigures1 = | leadfigures2 = | leadfigures3 = | howmany1 = | howmany2 = | howmany3 = | fatalities = | injuries = | arrests = | notes = }} The '''Nieuwmarkt riots''' ([[Dutch language|Dutch]]: ''Nieuwmarktrellen''), also referred to as the Amsterdam metro riots, is a series of serious disturbances in the [[Nieuwmarkt]] neighbourhood of [[Amsterdam]], [[Netherlands]]. On 24 March 1975, which later became known as ''Blue Monday'',{{cite book|author=Christopher Catling|title=Travellers Amsterdam|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=uEzYqqtBUMwC|date=1 June 2003|publisher=Thomas Cook Publishing|isbn=978-1-84157-261-1}} and on 8 April 1975, protests against the planned demolition of homes{{how many|date=September 2018}} ended in confrontations with over a hundred municipal police supported by 500 military police.{{Citation|last=Verstraete|first=Ginette|title=Underground Visions:: Strategies of Resistance along the Amsterdam Metro Lines|date=2013|url=http://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctt6wp6td.10|work=Paris-Amsterdam Underground|pages=77–96|series=Essays on Cultural Resistance, Subversion, and Diversion|publisher=Amsterdam University Press|isbn=9789089645050|access-date=2018-09-02}} The homes were considered by residents and protesters to be in good condition, but had to make way for the construction of the East Line tunnel of the [[Amsterdam metro]].{{cite web|url=http://stadsarchief.amsterdam.nl/english/amsterdam_treasures/civil_unrest/nieuwmarkt_abc/index.en.html|title=Civil unrest: Nieuwmarkt ABC|publisher=City Archives of Amsterdam|accessdate=2014-07-31|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130222141441/http://stadsarchief.amsterdam.nl/english/amsterdam_treasures/civil_unrest/nieuwmarkt_abc/index.en.html|archivedate=2013-02-22|df=}} This was needed because the construction of the 3.5 km tunnel was largely done by sinking large concrete caissons.{{fact|date=September 2018}} As a result of the riots, the city council of Amsterdam decided to abandon further plans for additional metro lines. In 1980, the [[Nieuwmarkt metro station]] was opened. It is decorated with artworks that memorialize the turbulent times.{{cite book|author=Susan S. Fainstein|title=The Just City|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bRPK3PWUvU8C&pg=PA146|date=22 July 2010|publisher=Cornell University Press|isbn=978-0-8014-6218-4|pages=146–}} ==See also== *[[Vondelstraat Riots]] *[[Amsterdam coronation riots]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:1975 in the Netherlands]] [[Category:1970s in Amsterdam]] [[Category:Riots and civil disorder in the Netherlands]] [[Category:1975 riots]] [[Category:Events in Amsterdam]] [[Category:March 1975 events]] [[Category:April 1975 events]] {{Netherlands-stub}}

{{short description|2018 rape and murder in Kanchanpur District, Nepal}} {{copy edit|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox news event | title = Nirmala Panta rape and murder
2018 Kanchanpur rape and murder
निर्मला पन्त बलात्कार तथा हत्याकाण्ड | image = | image_name = | image_size = | caption = | date = 26 July 2018 | time = After 3 pm [[Nepal Standard Time|NST]] ([[UTC+05:45]]) | place = [[Kanchanpur District]], [[Nepal]] | verdict = | sentence= | convictions = |suspects= Kiran Bista and Aayush Bista
Bam sisters | convicted = | outcome = Forged investigation | reported injuries = | reported death(s) = 1 (Nirmala Panta) on 26 July 2018 }} The '''Nirmala Panta rape and murder case''' ({{lang-ne|निर्मला पन्त बलात्कार तथा हत्याकाण्ड}}) or '''2018 Kanchanpur rape and murder case''' involved [[rape]] and murder of a schoolgirl that occurred on 26 July 2018 in [[Kanchanpur District]], [[Nepal]]. The incident took place when a 13-year-old female, Nirmala Panta, left for her friend's house and was found murdered in a sugarcane field the next day. The forensic report proved that the girl was raped. The incident out broke nationwide protests which resulted in the deaths of some protestors. ==Incident== [[File:Kanchanpur.png|thumb|[[Bhimdatta|Bhimdattanagar]] in Kanchanpur district]] On Thursday 26 July 2018, a ninth-grade schoolgirl Nirmala Panta of [[Bhimdatta|Bhimdattanagar]]-2, left her home for study in her friend Roshani Bam's house.{{cite web | url=https://myrepublica.nagariknetwork.com/news/teenager-raped-and-killed-in-kanchanpur/ | title=Teenager raped and killed in Kanchanpur}}{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-07-29/kanchanpur-tense-after-girls-rape-murder.html | title=Kanchanpur tense after girl's rape, murder}} [[MyRepublica]] explains that she went to the Bam's house, which was one and a half kilometers away from her home, around 11 a.m. and spent 3 hours there before she left around 3 p.m. afterward which she did not reach home. The relatives filed a complaint about a missing girl in the local police station but the police refused and instructed to come next morning. On Friday 27 July 2018, her dead body was found naked and placed on a one feet high waterlogged sugarcane field in Nimbukheda, Bhimdattanagar-18 about 500 meters far from Bam's house. ==Investigation== The local police identified Nirmala after her bicycle was found on the side of the road near the sugarcane farm. The local police stated that she was murdered after [[rape]] as per the preliminary report. CIB (Crime Investigation Bureau) team led by DSP Angur G.C. began the investigation on reaching Kanchanpur on four days after the incident. Kanchanpur Police and CIB team declared a mentally retarded man named ''Dilip Singh Bista'' as the culprit who was later proven innocent.{{cite web | url=https://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-17/new-team-to-scan-officers-for-faulty-investigation.html | title=New team to scan officers for faulty investigation}} According to the spokesperson of [[Nepal Police]] SSP Shailesh Thapa Kshetri, the DNA sample of Dilip Singh was found unmatched with the vaginal swab of the victim and thus was released on 12 September 2018. The local public including the victim's family believes that Dilip Singh was innocent and maliciously framed as chief culprit on 20 August 2018 by the Kanchanpur Police.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2018-09-12/bista-bam-sisters-released.html | title=Bista, Bam sisters released}} Bam sisters; Babita Bam and Roshani Bam were arrested on 23 August 2018 on the speculation of local public while they were also released after the legal consultation with District Attorney Office together with Dilip Singh. Hari Prasad Mainali, Director General of Department of Prison Management, led a committee formed on 23 August 2018 by the Nepalese government to investigate the activities of Crime Investigation Bureau team and the Kanchanpur Police after they had reported a mentally retarded man as the perpetrator. Kanchanpur Police Chief SP Dilli Raj Bista and Chief District Officer Kumar Bahadur Khadka were suspended for mishandling of the case on Saturday 25 August 2018.{{cite web | url=https://setopati.net/political/128910 | title=SP Bista to be suspended over mishandling of Nirmala Panta rape case}} and were replaced by new officials. The report of the Mainali Committee also resulted in the suspension of DSPs Gyan Bahadur Sethi and Angur GC, Inspectors Ekendra Khadka and Jagadish Bhatta and Assistant Sub-inspector Ram Singh Dhami by the [[Ministry of Home Affairs]] on Saturday.{{cite web | url=https://setopati.net/social/130408 | title=DIG Dhiru Basnet to lead investigation of rape and murder of Nirmala Panta}} The police did not use the four [[sniffer dog]]s stationed at the provincial capital in [[Dhangadhi]] which locals consider to be a sheer negligence of the police.{{cite web | url=https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/police-question-bam-sisters-over-rape-murder-of-nirmala-panta/ | title=Police question Bam sisters on rape, murder of Nirmala Panta| date=2018-08-30}} On Monday 17 September 2018, nine police officials were interrogated for their connections in the investigation of the case which included Kanchanpur Police Chief SP Dili Raj Bista.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2018-09-18/basnyat-panel-grills-police-officials.html | title=Basnyat panel grills police officials}} However, Birendra K.C. quitted the Home Ministry investigation panel citing that the life threat was prevalent on him and his family from the group actively trying to undermine the investigation. As per spokesperson of [[Nepal Police]] SSP Shailesh Thapa Kshetri, the DNA sample of SP Bista, his son Kiran Bista and Aayush Bista, nephew of Mayor of [[Bhimdatta]] Surendra Bista have been taken together with the vaginal swab of the victim for further investigation. On 17 September 2018, a new investigation committee was set up by [[Nepal Police]] under DIG (Deputy Inspector General of Police) Dhiru Basnyat to overtake the former investigation committee led by SSP Uttam Subedi. On the same day, Prime Minister [[Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli]] asserted that the assurance put upon the local police led to the derailment of the investigation. He speculates that either the police have forged the investigation or had committed mistakes in the investigation. Panta couples traveled 35 hours bus journey to [[Kathmandu]] to draw the attention of the central government on the case. PM Oli assured Panta couples to prosecute and punish the guilty person irrespective of his money, power, post or influences. On 18 September 2018, the Kanchanpur police chief SP Kuber Kathayat admitted that there is no concrete evidence till date and investigation was ongoing. The government had earlier set up investigation panel due to the destruction of evidence by the local investigating police after the discovery of the body of the victim.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-18/investigators-still-clueless.html | title=Kanchanpur rape and murder case: Investigators still 'clueless'}} DIG Dhiru Basnyat who was appointed as the leading officer to a nine-member probe committee formed on 16 September 2018 for new investigation{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-16/kanchanpur-rape-and-murder-probe-committee-formed-under-dig-dhiru-basnet.html | title=Kanchanpur rape and murder: Probe committee formed under DIG Dhiru Basnyat}}, stated to begin the investigation from a completely new perspective.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-16/kanchanpur-rape-and-murder-probe-committee-formed-under-dig-dhiru-basnet.html | title=Kanchanpur rape and murder: Probe committee formed under DIG Dhiru Basnyat}} ==Demands and Opinions== The brother of the victim, Laxmi Prasad Panta, asserted that the last rites will not be performed unless the perpetrators are punished, the victim's family are compensated and a police beat is established at Nimbukheda. On 12 September 2018 in a conversation with [[The Himalayan Times]], Yagya Raj Panta, father of Nirmala Panta, spoke about the atrocities of local police and local authorities and their forceful exertions to cremate the dead body instead of full-fledged investigation. Yagya Raj Panta and his wife Durga Devi Panta, continuously believe that Babita Bam and Roshani Bam (friend of Nirmala) are prime suspects. He quoted:
{{Quote|text=The authorities mistreated us from the Day One of the incident despite the fact that we were the victims. The police didn’t even let us shed tears right after we came to know about our daughter’s death. They used harsh language and dragged us to their office and district administration office every now and then. The chief district officer, who has now been transferred, on the other hand, exerted pressure on us to cremate the body immediately instead of focusing on rounding up the criminal.{{cite web | url=https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/nirmala-panta-parents-in-capital-seeking-justice/ | title=Nirmala's parents in capital seeking justice| date=2018-09-13}}}}
Nirmala's mother Durga Devi accused local police of destroying the evidence and misleading the investigation:{{quote|How can we expect justice to be delivered under these circumstances? What is even more worrying is all the evidences at the crime scene have been erased by the police. Worse, the investigation is not headed in the right direction, which is creating more confusion.}} The locals continuously believe that Dilip Singh Bista was framed by the police to hide the real culprits. They demanded that the [[Nepal Army]] be investigated as an army barrack was near to the incident site. ==Reactions and Public Protests== The incident sparked public outrage and eventually broke social media which resulted in many public demonstrations. Prime Minister [[Khadga Prasad Sharma Oli]] in a meeting with the victim's parents and lawmakers of [[Province No. 7]], gave an assurance of justice to the victim's parents.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-17/pm-assures-of-justice-to-nirmalas-parents.html | title=PM assures of justice to Nirmala's parents}} In the public demonstrations in the Bhimdattanagar, one boy has died in the clash against the police forces. The events of public protests are chronologically arranged: *On Friday evening 27 July 2018, the students of Nepal Student Union demonstrations and shut down the Bazaar Area of [[Bhimdatta]] which resulted in a clash with the security personnel. *On Saturday 28 July 2018, the victim's family together with the local civilians, women rights' organization, and sister organizations of the opposition party [[Nepali Congress]] protested the failure of police to find the culprits and demanded security be established at the incident site. On Saturday, the victim's family and relatives staged demonstrations at the Mahakali Zonal Hospital, the Bazaar Area and the municipal corporation. *On 23 August 2018, locals in Kanchanpur staged demonstrations, market shutdown and burning of tyres to protest the failure of police to find the real culprits. Demonstrations have been ongoing in Bhimdatta, Bhansi, Suda, Lalpur, Sisaiya, Daiji, Champhapur and adjacent areas since the incident.{{cite web | url=https://setopati.net/social/128780 | title=Demonstrations about Nirmala Panta rape case continue}} *On 15 September 2018, a mass rally was organized at Maitighar Mandala, [[Kathmandu]] with the slogan of ''Justice for Nirmala''. The rally converged into a corner assembly at New Baneshwor.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-15/massive-rally-organised-in-kathmandu-demanding-justice-for-panta-with-video.html | title=Massive rally in Kathmandu demanding justice for Nirmala Panta (With video)}} * On Tuesday 18 September 2018, [[Nepali Congress]] organized a rally at [[Mahendranagar, Mahakali|Mahendranagar]] which was joined by the Panta couples demanding the identification of the perpetrator of the incident and punishment to culprits. They submitted a memorandum of demand to the Chief District Officer of Kanchanpur, Taranath Adhikari.{{cite web | url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-09-19/nirmalas-parents-join-nepali-congress-rally-in-mahendranagar-demanding-justice.html | title=Nirmala's parents join Nepali Congress rally in Mahendranagar demanding justice}} * On the same day, students of the Janajyoti Multiple Campus of [[Sarlahi district]] organized a rally at [[Lalbandi]], Sarlahi where hundreds of students, civil society leaders, political leaders and women rights' activist took part demanding justice to the victim. *On 30 October 2018, family, friends, relatives and human rights' activist led a rally in Mahendranagar demanding justice for the rape victim and punitive action against SP Dilli Raj Bista and Inspector Jagadish Prasad Bhatta.https://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2018-10-30/nirmalas-parents-demand-punitive-action-against-bista-and-bhatta.html ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/tag/nirmala+panta Kantipur topic - Nirmala Panta] {{DEFAULTSORT:Kanchanpur rape}} [[Category:Murder in 2018]] [[Category:Rape in Nepal]] [[Category:Incidents of violence against women]] [[Category:2018 crimes in Nepal]] [[Category:Murder in 2018]] [[Category:Murder in Nepal]] [[Category:Rape in Nepal]] [[Category:Violence against women]] [[Category:Incidents of violence against women]] [[Category:July 2018 events in Asia]] [[Category:Sex crimes]] [[Category:People murdered in Nepal]]

revision.text:
'''Parental alienation''' is the process, and the result, of [[psychological manipulation]] of a child into showing unwarranted fear, disrespect or hostility towards a parent and/or other family members.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":0">{{cite book|last1=Warshak|first1=Richard A.|title=Divorce Poison|date=2009|publisher=Harper Collins|isbn=978-0061984235|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QRkMjqXrmsIC|accessdate=1 October 2017}}</ref> It is a distinctive form of psychological abuse, towards both the child and the rejected family members, that occurs almost exclusively in association with family separation or divorce, particularly where legal action is involved.<ref>{{Cite book|title = The High-Conflict Custody Battle: Protect Yourself and Your Kids from a Toxic Divorce, False Accusations, and Parental Alienation|last = Baker|first = AJL|publisher = New Harbinger|year = 2014|isbn = 9781626250734|location = Oakland, USA|pages = }}</ref> It undermines core principles of both the [[Universal Declaration of Human Rights]] and the United Nations [[Convention on the Rights of the Child]]. Most commonly, the primary cause is a parent wishing to exclude another parent from the life of their child, but other family members or friends, as well as professionals involved with the family (including psychologists, lawyers and judges), may contribute significantly to the process.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite journal|url = http://aaml.org/sites/default/files/MAT107_7.pdf|title = Parental Alienation: Overview, Management, Intervention, and Practice Tips.|last = Warshak|first = R.A.|date = 2015|journal = Journal of the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers|doi = |pmid = |access-date = 1 October 2017}}</ref> It often leads to the long-term, or even permanent, [[Family estrangement|estrangement]] of a child from one parent and other family members<ref>{{Cite book|title = Adult Children of Parental Alienation: Breaking the Ties that Bind|last = Baker|first = Amy, J.L.|publisher = W.W. Norton & Co.|year = 2007|isbn = 978-0393705195|location = |pages = }}</ref> and, as a particularly [[Adverse Childhood Experiences Study|adverse childhood experience]], results in significantly increased lifetime risks of both mental and physical illness.<ref name="bernetw"/>
== Overview == First described in 1976 as "pathological alignment", parental alienation refers to a situation in which a child unreasonably rejects a non-custodial parent.<ref name = Bow2009>{{cite journal | last = Bow | first = JN |author2=Gould JW |author3=Flens JR | year = 2009 | title = Examining Parental Alienation in Child Custody Cases: A Survey of Mental Health and Legal Professionals | journal = The American Journal of Family Therapy | volume = 37 | issue = 2 | pages = 127–145 | doi = 10.1080/01926180801960658|url=http://www.drjamesrflens.com/_Bow_et_al.__2009___Examing_parental_alienation_in_child_custody_case.pdf }}</ref> [[Richard A. Gardner]] proposed [[parental alienation syndrome]] in the 1980s based on his clinical experience with the children of divorcing parents. Parental alienation lacks a single definition and its existence, cause and characteristics have been the subject of debate. Gardner's concept of a syndrome has failed to gain acceptance. Some [[empirical research]] has been performed, though the quality of the studies vary widely and research in the area is still developing.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Hands | first1 = A. J. | last2 = Warshak | first2 = R. A. | year = 2011 | title = Parental Alienation Among College Students | url = | journal = The American Journal of Family Therapy | volume = 39 | issue = 5| pages = 431–443 | doi=10.1080/01926187.2011.575336}}</ref>
A survey of literature suggests that alienating behaviors by both parents are common in high-conflict divorces.<ref name = Bow2009/> Rejected parents tend to lose a sense of warmth and empathy with the child. As a result, the rejected parent may become passive, depressed, anxious, and withdrawn – characteristics that may encourage further rejection. The parent that the child aligns with (the aligned parent) may engage in alienating behaviors, including undermining the other parent. These behaviors may be conscious and deliberate or may reflect a lack of awareness on the effect of the actions on the children. Direct alienating behaviors occur when one parent actively undermines the other parent, such as making derogatory remarks about the other parent, telling the child that the other parent is responsible for the separation, or telling the child that the other parent is the cause of financial difficulties. Indirect alienation behaviors occur when one parent fails to support access or contact with the other parent or tacitly accepts the child's negative behaviour and comments towards the other parent.<ref name = Bow2009/><ref name = Bala2007/>
=== Causes === The causes of alienation can be divided into two broad categories, *Realistic estrangement, in which a parent's harmful or abusive behaviors or substance abuse result in the alienation of the child;<ref name=acorn/> and *Pathological alienation, in which the alienation results from pathological aspects of the child's family relationships, and is not a rational response to the behavior of the alienated parent. Realistic estrangement is a different phenomenon from "pathological alienation". The former is an understandable refusal by a child to see an [[child abuse|abusive]] parent, while the latter is emotionally harmful and unjustified.<ref name = Bala2007/>
=== Symptoms === Symptoms associated with parental alienation include: *The child engages in a pattern of "denigration" against a targeted parent for unjustified reasons and uses "frivolous rationalizations" that are "disproportionate" to the circumstances.<ref name=inq/> *The child may display a "complete lack of ambivalence" wherein the rejected parent is viewed as "all bad" and the favored parent is viewed as "all good."<ref name=echo/> This lack of ambivalence is associated with "[[Splitting (psychology)|splitting]]."<ref name="newsweek2014">{{cite journal|title=Bernet et al. (2017). An Objective Measure of Splitting in Parental Alienation: The Parental Acceptance-Rejection Questionnaire. Journal of Forensic Sciences. doi: 10.1111/1556-4029.13625|journal=Journal of Forensic Sciences|volume=63|issue=3|pages=776–783|last1=Bernet|first1=William|last2 = Gregory|first2=Nilgun|last3=Reay|first3=Kathleen M.|last4=Rohner|first4=Ronald P.|doi=10.1111/1556-4029.13625|pmid=28833110|year = 2018}}</ref> Splitting refers to a primitive division of the ego into "all good" and "all bad" objects to prevent the "generalization of anxiety."<ref>{{Cite book|title=Kernberg, O. F. (1995). Borderline Conditions and Pathological Narcissism.|last=|first=|publisher=Jason Aronson, Inc.|year=1995|isbn=9780876681770|edition= Reissue|location=Princeton, NJ|pages=|language=English}}</ref> *The child may display "reflexive support" for the parent they favor during disagreements between the rejected parent and the favored parent.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://psychlaw.net/criteria-for-the-diagnosis-of-parental-alienation/|title=Lorandos, D. (2016). "Criteria for the Diagnosis of Parental Alienation." PsychLaw.net|last=|first=|date=|website=www.psychlaw.net|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=19 August 2018}}</ref> *The child may use "borrowed scenarios" that involve making "identical" statements to those of the "alienating parent" when the alienating parent makes disparaging comments against the rejected parent.<ref name=":1" /> *The child may display an "independent thinker phenomenon" which involves comments by the child that their decision to reject the targeted parent was arrived at without any influence from the alienating parent.<ref>{{Cite journal|title=Baker, J. L. & Darnall, D. C. (2007). A Construct Study of the Eight Symptoms of Severe Parental Alienation Syndrome. Journal of Divorce & Remarriage, 47(1-2).|journal=Journal of Divorce & Remarriage|volume=47|pages=55–75|doi=10.1300/J087v47n01_04|year = 2007|last1 = Baker|first1 = Amy J. L.|last2=Damall|first2=Douglas C.}}</ref> *The child may display an "absence of guilt" regarding their denigration of the targeted parent.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fact.on.ca/Info/pas/gard02c.htm|title=Gardner, R. A. (2002). The Empowerment of Children in the Development of Parental Alienation Syndrome. The American Journal of Forensic Psychology, 20(2), 5-29.|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=19 August 2018}}</ref> *The child's vilification of the targeted parent spreads to "extended family" members.<ref name=":2" />
==Theories== Some researchers emphasized the role of an alienating parent, termed variously the "programming" parent or "embittered-chaotic parent",<ref name = Bow2009/> while other researchers have focused on the "alienated child", and the relationship dynamics that contribute to the alienation.<ref name="Bala2007">{{cite journal |last = Bala|first = N|author2 = Fidler B|author3 = Goldberg D|author4 = Houston C|year = 2007|journal = Queens Law Journal|volume = 33|title = Alienated Children and Parental Separation: Legal Responses from Canada's Family Courts|pages = 79–138|url = http://heinonline.org/HOL/LandingPage?collection=journals&handle=hein.journals/queen33&div=7&id=&page=}}</ref><ref name=Jaffe2002>{{cite book |last=Jaffe |first=PG |author2=Lemon NKD |author3=Poisson SE |title=Child Custody & Domestic Violence |publisher=[[SAGE Publications]] |year=2002 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=bbZmp7ALOq4C&pg=PA52 52–54] |isbn=978-0-7619-1826-4}}</ref>
Within the context of relationship dynamics, alienation is seen as a breakdown of [[attachment (psychology)|attachment]] between parent and child that may be caused by a variety factors. These researchers have proposed a more complex analysis, in which all family members may play a role in the alienation. This "systems-based" view acknowledges that a child may be alienated from one parent with no alienation programming from the other parent.<ref name = Bow2009/><ref name = Bala2007/> The behaviors of all family members, including those of the alienated parent, may lead to [[family dysfunction]] and the rejection of a parent.<ref name= Ackerman2001>{{cite book |author=Ackerman MJ |title=Clinician's guide to child custody evaluations |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons|Wiley]] |location=New York |year=2001 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=q9E_rg94Cs4C&pg=PA73 73–82] |isbn=978-0-471-39260-6}}</ref><ref name=Waldron1996>{{cite journal |last=Waldron |first=KH |author2=Joanis DE |url= http://fact.on.ca/Info/pas/waldron.htm |title=Understanding and Collaboratively Treating Parental Alienation Syndrome |journal=American Journal of Family Law |volume=10 |pages= 121–133 |year=1996}}</ref> Under this approach, when a child is estranged from a parent it is necessary to evaluate all contributing factors and all possible remedies to the estrangement.<ref name=Bala2007/><ref name=Sparta2006>{{cite book |last=Sparta |first=SN |author2=Koocher GP |title=Forensic Mental Health Assessment of Children and Adolescents |publisher=[[Oxford University Press]] |year=2006 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=6bmBtQ2Zl-IC&pg=PA83 83], [https://books.google.com/books?id=6bmBtQ2Zl-IC&pg=PA219 219–221] |isbn=978-0-19-514584-7}}</ref>
===Motivation=== In one conception of parental alienation, driven by a specific parent, a parent who experienced feelings of inadequacy or abandonment in their childhood can have those feelings re-triggered by a divorce or breakup. In response, that parent can [[Repetition compulsion#Postmodern formulations|reenact]]<ref name=acorn/><ref name=Pingitore2015/><ref name=Pearlman2005>{{cite journal | last=Pearlman | first=Laurie| title=Clinical Applications of the Attachment Framework: Relational Treatment of Complex Trauma | journal=Journal of Traumatic Stress | volume=18 | issue= 5| year = 2005 | pages=449–459 | doi= 10.1002/jts.20052| pmid=16281242| url=http://delphicentre.com.au/uploads/Pearlman,%20L.A.,%20Courtois,%20C.%20%282005%29%20RelationalTxofCmplxtTrauma.JTS.pdf}}</ref><ref name=Levy1998>{{cite journal | last=Levy | first=Michael| title=A Helpful Way to Conceptualize and Understand Reenactments | journal = The Journal of Psychotherapy Practice and Research | volume=7 | issue=3 | year = 1998 | pages=227–235 | doi= | pmc=3330499 | pmid=9631344}}</ref><ref name=Sadock>{{cite book|author=Benjamin Sadock PhD|title=Kaplan & Sadock's Concise Textbook of Clinical Psychiatry|publisher=LWWW|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=ubG51n2NgfwC&pg=PA261&lpg=PA261&dq=trauma+reenactment+textbook&source=bl&ots=tn2C5lygwY&sig=ejbMNsLZBQcOKx03tKH1Su74ebI&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CIcBEOgBMAlqFQoTCO_K7vPjgcgCFcFxPgodWvYFkw#v=onepage&q=trauma%20reenactment%20textbook&f=false 216]|isbn=978-0781787468|year=2008}}</ref><ref name=Kolk1997>{{cite journal | last=van der Kolk | first=B.A.| title=The psychological consequences of overwhelming life experiences | journal=Psychological Trauma | volume=7 | issue=3 | year = 1987 | pages=5 | doi= | url= }}</ref><ref name=Kolk2005>{{cite journal | last=van der Kolk | first=B.A.| title=Developmental Trauma Disorder: Towards a rational diagnosis for children with complex trauma histories. | journal=Psychiatric Annals | volume=35 | issue=5 | year = 2005 | pages=401–408 | doi= | url=http://www.traumacenter.org/products/pdf_files/preprint_dev_trauma_disorder.pdf}}</ref><ref name=Reyes2008>{{cite book |last=Reyes |first=Gilbert |author2=Elhai Jon |title=The Encyclopedia of Psychological Trauma |publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons|Wiley]] |year=2000 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=O3rSIn_qTkAC&pg=PT1119&dq=The+Encyclopedia+of+Psychological+Trauma+reenactment&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CB0Q6AEwAGoVChMI852c5f2MyAIVw6uACh1BCAJL#v=snippet&q=Reenactment&f=false 0] |isbn=978-0470110065}}</ref><ref name=LeadershipCouncilBrain>{{cite web|last1=van der Kolk|first1=BA|title=The compulsion to repeat the trauma|url=http://www.leadershipcouncil.org/1/res/brain.html|website=The Leadership Council on Child Abuse & Interpersonal Violence : The Effect of Childhood Trauma on Brain Development |accessdate=5 December 2015}}</ref> a false narrative related to their own childhood, where the child's other parent symbolizes an inadequate or abusive parent, the child symbolizes a victim of the other parent, and the parent using harmful parenting practices symbolizes a good parent ostensibly trying to protect their child.<ref name=Fidler>{{cite book|author=Barbara Jo Fidler|title=Children Who Resist Postseparation Parental Contact: A Differential Approach for Legal and Mental Health Professionals |publisher=Oxford University Press |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=ocUupL4YcnkC&pg=PA47&lpg=PA47&dq=%22Parental+alienation+and+the+DSM+V%22&source=bl&ots=AAdSCewGoX&sig=oZCnKkZpvL-M-J6Ckbf2p5Bp3tg&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CD8Q6AEwBWoVChMI2IzqnvGxyAIVS5qACh3_WQDE#v=onepage&q=%22the%20favored%20parent%20may%20have%20a%20personality%20disorder%20or%20mental%20illness%22&f=false 30]|isbn=978-0199895496|date=2012-09-13 }}</ref> The role of the bystander such as friends, therapists, and judges is to confirm the delusion for the parent, which was already partially confirmed for them by the child acting like a victim<ref name=acorn/><ref name=Greenfield2015/><ref name=newsweek2014/><ref name=Pearlman2005/> However, in reality, the other parent is neither inadequate nor abusive; rather, the parent using the harmful parenting practices is abusive.<ref name=acorn/><ref name=Pingitore2015/><ref name=Greenfield2015/> In effect, the parent who fears inadequacy or abandonment is able to [[Psychological projection|project]] their fears onto the other parent<ref name=acorn/> because "all can plainly see" that it is the other parent who is rejected and abandoned by the child and who is "inadequate".<ref name=echo/>
A parent who uses harmful parenting practices may suffer from [[borderline personality disorder]] or [[narcissistic personality disorder]],<ref name=inq/><ref name=acorn/><ref name=echo/><ref name=stines2015/><ref name=Greenfield2015/><ref name=Fidler/> related to an experience of feeling inadequate or abandoned while growing up. This feeling can be re-triggered by a divorce or breakup, causing them to [[Decompensation#Psychology|decompensate]] into [[persecutory delusions]].<ref name=Pingitore2015/><ref name=stines2015/><ref name=Fidler/><ref name=Millon2011>{{cite book |author=Theodore Million|title=Disorders of Personality:Introducing a DSM / ICD Spectrum from Normal to Abnormal 3rd Edition|publisher=[[John Wiley & Sons|Wiley]]|year=2011 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=-u5lAsunPu0C&pg=PA407&dq=millon+persecutory+delusion+decompensation+%22Under+conditions+of+unrelieved+adversity+and+failure%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCQQ6AEwAWoVChMI48v_nsrZxwIVC8uACh09uAUy#v=onepage&q=millon%20persecutory%20delusion%20decompensation%20%22Under%20conditions%20of%20unrelieved%20adversity%20and%20failure%22&f=false 407–408] |isbn=978-0470040935}}</ref><ref name=Masterson1981>{{cite book |author=James Masterson, M.D.|title=The Narcissistic and Borderline Disorders: An Integrated Developmental Approach|publisher=[[Routledge]]|year=1981 |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=grUdWczSIoUC&pg=PA38&lpg=PA38&dq=acute+psychotic+decompensation+with+paranoid+ideation&source=bl&ots=gU5fr-nUqr&sig=3sJZQo8yyj6IcFoXP8lfhr6XvZE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAGoVChMIuMfR4J7axwIViBweCh2nWAh-#v=onepage&q=acute%20psychotic%20decompensation%20with%20acute%20paranoid%20ideation&f=false 38] |isbn=978-0876302927}}</ref> These parents may believe that they do not need to follow social norms of fairness,<ref name=inq/><ref name=echo/> and they may "parentify their own children",<ref name=Oldham2007parentify>{{cite book|last1=Oldham|first1=John M.|last2=Skodol|first2=Andrew E.|last3=Bender|first3=Donna S.|title=The American Psychiatric Publishing Textbook of Personality Disorders|date=2007|publisher=American Psychiatric Publishing|isbn=978-1585626625|pages=364|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=gxpXTm9T1MsC&pg=PA364|accessdate=1 October 2017}}</ref> "excessively bind their children to themselves",<ref name=Oldham2007parentify/> "demand absolute, unlimited control over their children while threatening rejection",<ref name=Oldham2007parentify/> project their own fears onto the other parent,<ref name=Oldham2007parentify/> abandon their spouse in favor of their children,<ref name=Oldham2007parentify/> and revive their own childhood attachment trauma after a difficult experience.<ref name=Oldham2007parentify/>
===Mechanism=== The techniques of harmful parenting may be subtle and "genuine".<ref name=inq/><ref name=acorn/><ref name=Fidler/> A parent can [[Triangulation (psychology)|triangulate]] the child into the marital conflict<ref name="irishtimes">{{cite web |last1=Gartland |first1=Fiona |title=Jail time for parental alienation not in best interests of children |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/crime-and-law/jail-time-for-parental-alienation-not-in-best-interests-of-children-1.2350370 |website=Irish Times |accessdate=29 September 2015}}</ref> by encouraging the child to make even minor complaints about the other parent and then "enthusiastically validating" them. This signals to the child that the other parent is dangerous<ref name=echo/><ref name="BakerSurviving">{{cite web |last1=Baker |first1=Amy |title=Surviving Parental Alienation, Part 2: The parental alienation tipping point |url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/caught-between-parents/201410/surviving-parental-alienation-part-2|website=Psychology Today |accessdate=3 October 2015}}</ref>{{mcn|date=November 2017}} and insensitive.<ref name=echo/><ref name=BakerSurviving/> This encouragement to complain manipulates the child into the role of victim without the child's awareness,<ref name=stines2015/><ref name=BakerSurviving/> allowing the parent to move into the protector role, forcing the other parent into the "inadequate" parent role, and leaving no trace of what happened for bystanders who only see the child acting as a "victim".<ref name=echo/><ref name=Greenfield2015/><ref name=newsweek2014/> Over time, the combined effects of growing closer to the alienating parent through this complaining process<ref name=echo/> and growing further from the rejected parent as the result of focusing on negative things about the other parent cause the child to reject their other parent as being inadequate.
A parent may also mix in [[lie]]s,<ref name=echo/> partial lies,<ref name=BakerSurviving/>{{ums|date=November 2017}} and [[exaggerations]],<ref name=echo/> particularly ones that the child may not be able to verify or where only the true part of the partial lie is easy to verify.<ref name=toxicex>{{cite book|last1=Baker|first1=Amy|title=Coparenting with a Toxic Ex|date=2014|publisher=New Harbinger Publications|isbn=978-1608829583|pages=85–86}}</ref> As the result of being encouraged to act as judge of their rejected parent,<ref name=echo/> the child then feels superior to their rejected parent, leading to the symptoms of [[grandiosity]], entitlement, and haughty arrogance. This feeds the [[delusion]] of the parent, that they are protecting the child from an inadequate parent.<ref name=Greenfield2015/> The child then begins to adopt this [[delusion]] also.<ref name=acorn/><ref name=echo/><ref name=newsweek2014/>
Because the child and parent are from different generations, this qualifies as a [[Triangulation (psychology)#The Perverse Triangle|perverse triangle]],<ref name=Gottlieb2012>{{cite book|author=Linda Gottlieb|title=THE PARENTAL ALIENATION SYNDROME: A Family Therapy and Collaborative Systems Approach to Amelioration|publisher=Charles C Thomas|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=WMTwCAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=linda+gottlieb+the+parental+alienation+syndrome&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CBwQ6AEwAGoVChMIurOG0IWOyAIVTI6SCh3zGANw#v=onepage&q=perverse%20triangle&f=false 4,87,180,214,222,249,254,258,259]|isbn=978-0398087364|year=2012}}</ref><ref name=BakerWorking>{{cite book|author=Amy J. L. Baker PhD|title=WORKING WITH ALIENATED FAMILIES A Clinical Guidebook|publisher=Routeledge|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=Rxq-Bsj18ZgC&pg=PT172&lpg=PT172&dq=#v=onepage&q=perverse%20triangle&f=false 200, 230,238]|isbn=978-0415518031|year=2013}}</ref> further complicated by [[enmeshment]],<ref name=LudmerIntervention/><ref name=Goldstein>{{cite book|author=Mark Goldstein|title=Handbook of Child Custody|publisher=Springer|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=s79OCgAAQBAJ&pg=PA185&lpg=PA185&dq=%22parental+alienation%22+enmeshed&source=bl&ots=6GzVXAjF8W&sig=2ZVRNbjnqGnCIiSKEHU2pe3sA38&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CE0Q6AEwCTgyahUKEwj9sOags6fIAhXJPB4KHWTQDMI#v=onepage&q=enmeshed&f=false 186, 194, 267]|isbn=978-3319139418}}</ref><ref name=Kruk2013Reunite>{{cite web|last1=Kruk|first1=Edward|title=Parent-Child Reunification After Alienation: Strategies to Reunite Alienated Parents and Their Children|url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/co-parenting-after-divorce/201305/parent-child-reunification-after-alienation|website=Psychology Today|accessdate=3 October 2015}}</ref><ref name="BakerBreakingEnmesh">{{cite book|author = Baker, A.J.L.|title = Adult Children of Parental Alienation Syndrome: Breaking the Ties That Bind|publisher = W. W. Norton & Company|pages = |isbn = 978-0393705195|year = 2007}}</ref><ref name=Cowen2014>{{cite book|author=Philip A. Cowan|title=Family, Self, and Society: Toward A New Agenda for Family Research |publisher=Routledge |pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=yGehAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA206&dq=minuchin+%22loss++of++psychological++boundaries%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CB0Q6AEwAGoVChMIstKSxZazyAIVSBc-Ch2Obg8g#v=onepage&q=minuchin%20%22loss%20%20of%20%20psychological%20%20boundaries%22&f=false 206]|isbn=978-0805809992|year=1993 }}</ref>{{mcn|date=November 2017}} and made even worse because a member of the [[Triangulation (psychology)#The Perverse Triangle|perverse triangle]] has a personality disorder,<ref name=inq/><ref name=acorn/><ref name=echo/><ref name=Greenfield2015/> climaxed by the [[Splitting (psychology)|splitting dynamic]] of the parent with the personality disorder that requires the ex-spouse to also become the ex-parent of the child.<ref name=Pingitore2015/> Finally, the child may be led to misinterpret the grief they experience from the loss of a parent as pain that means the rejected parent is abusive, since they mainly experience it in the presence of the rejected parent.<ref name=stines2015/>
===Treatment=== The success of restoring the child's [[Attachment in children|attachment]] to their parent hinges on first protecting the child from harmful parenting.<ref name=acorn/><ref name=Greenfield2015/> A study suggests that the child does not experience this protection as being traumatic.<ref name=Greenfield2015/><ref name=Kruk2015>{{cite web|last1=Kruk|first1=Edward|title=Recent Advances in Understanding Parental Alienation: Implications of Parental Alienation Research for Family-Based Intervention|url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/co-parenting-after-divorce/201507/recent-advances-in-understanding-parental-alienation|website=Psychology Today|accessdate=13 September 2015}}</ref>
According to one theory,<ref name=LudmerIntervention/> when symptoms of alienation are present, structured intervention is likely to be more effective than traditional counseling. Structured intervention involves: * developing critical thinking to overcome rejection and enmeshment dynamics * resetting the child's place in the family hierarchy * addressing the family system * temporarily protecting the child from the bad parenting practices of the enmeshed parent.
Advocates of structured intervention argue that traditional counseling, based on the therapeutic alliance, is susceptible to: * delays from a lack of milestones and schedules * sabotage by a parent with an interest in making it fail * exclusive focus on a child's feelings and complaints to the exclusion of addressing the family system * the ineffectiveness of a parent apologizing for fabricated, exaggerated, or distorted complaints.
=== Other approaches === Some<ref name="inq">{{cite web|url=http://www.ccthomas.com/details.cfm?P_ISBN13=9780398088811|title=Lorandos et al. (2013). PARENTAL ALIENATION: The Handbook for Mental Health and Legal Professionals. Springfield, IL: Charles C. Thomas.|last1=|first1=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=19 August 2018}}</ref><ref name=acorn>{{cite web|last1=Bertholdo|first1=Stephanie|title=PARENT ALIENATION What happens when ex-spouses wage war with children on the front line|url=https://www.toacorn.com/articles/parent-alienation/|website=Thousand Oaks Acorn|accessdate=29 August 2015|date=2013-08-15}}</ref><ref name="echo">{{cite web|url=https://www.fact.on.ca/Info/pas/gardnr85.pdf|title=Gardner, R. A. (1985). Recent Trends in Divorce and Custody Litigation. Academy Forum, 29(2), 3-7.|last1=|first1=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=19 August 2018}}</ref><ref name=Pingitore2015>{{cite web|last1=Pingitore|first1=Marco| title=Parental Alienation, Interview with Craig Childress | url=http://www.psicologiagiuridica.eu/alienazione-parentale-intervista-craig-childress/2015/10/05/ | website=Italian Society of Forensic Science|accessdate=3 October 2015}}</ref><ref name=LudmerIntervention>{{cite web|last1=Ludmer|first1=Brian|title=Structured intervention trumps therapy in child estrangement cases|url=http://www.advocatedaily.com/Structured-intervention-trumps-therapy-in-child-estrangement-cases.html|website=Advocate Daily|accessdate=2 November 2015}}</ref><ref name=stines2015>{{cite web|last1=Stines|first1=Sharie|title=Narcissism and Parental Alienation Syndrome|url=http://pro.psychcentral.com/recovery-expert/2015/11/narcissism-and-parental-alienation-syndrome|website=Psych Central|accessdate=8 November 2015|date=2015-11-02}}</ref> have discussed a different approach for severe cases that defines a set of psychological symptoms in a child and proposes a psychological explanation for how those symptoms were caused by harmful parenting practices and why a parent would employ those parenting practices.<ref name=inq/><ref name=acorn/><ref name=echo/> In this approach, the phenomenon is seen simply as a combination of psychological problems, each of which psychologists understand and recognize.<ref name=Greenfield2015>{{cite web|last1=Greenfield|first1=Beth|title=The Controversial Therapy That's Shaping Custody Battles|url=https://www.yahoo.com/parenting/the-controversial-therapy-thats-shaping-custody-128797596692.html|website=Yahoo Parenting|accessdate=13 September 2015}}</ref> According to this theoretical formulation, "the pathology traditionally called ‘parental alienation' are manifestations of well-established forms of existing pathologies.”<ref name=Pingitore2015/><ref name=Greenfield2015/>
== Professional acceptance == The history of parental alienation reflects an evolution of its acceptance by professionals involved in custody cases. A 2009 survey of mental health and legal professionals found broad skepticism of the concept of parental alienation syndrome, and caution in relation to the concept of parental alienation.<ref name = Bow2009/>
===Mental health professionals=== Mental health professionals are reluctant to recognize so-called parental alienation syndrome.<ref name = Bow2009/> In the past, the American Psychiatric Association and American Psychological Association<ref>{{cite web|title=Statement on Parental Alienation Syndrome|url=http://www.apa.org/news/press/releases/2008/01/pas-syndrome.aspx|website=American Psychological Association|accessdate=7 October 2017|date=1 January 2008}}</ref> have held a neutral view of parental alienation as a distinct syndrome.<ref>'Parental Alienation, DSM-5, and ICD-11: Response to Critics' William Bernet, MD and Amy J. L. Baker, PhD (2013)</ref>
In anticipation of the fifth version of the [[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders]], which was released in 2013, William Bernet argued for the inclusion of ''parental alienation disorder'', a diagnosis related to parental alienation. His conception makes reference to parental alienation and a variety of other descriptions of behaviors he believes represent the underlying concept of parental alienation disorder.<ref name=Bernet2008>{{cite journal | last=Bernet | first=W| title= Parental Alienation Disorder and DSM-V | journal = The American Journal of Family Therapy | volume = 36 | issue = 5 | year = 2008 | pages = 349–366 | doi = 10.1080/01926180802405513 }}</ref> Despite lobbying by proponents,<ref name="Rotstein2010">{{cite news|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10046/1036018-114.stm|title=Mental health professionals getting update on definitions|last=Rotstein|first=Gary|date=February 15, 2010 |work=Pittsburgh Post-Gazette |accessdate=2010-03-02 }}</ref> in December 2012, the proposal was rejected.<ref>{{cite web|title=American Psychiatric Association Board of Trustees Approves DSM-5-Diagnostic manual passes major milestone before May 2013 publication|url=http://dsmfacts.org/materials/american-psychiatric-association-board-of-trustees-approves-dsm-5/|publisher=American Psychiatric Association|date=1 December 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131005021044/http://dsmfacts.org/materials/american-psychiatric-association-board-of-trustees-approves-dsm-5/|archivedate=5 October 2013|df=}}</ref>
Some argue that elements of parental alienation are covered in the [[DSM-5]] under the diagnosis: "Parent-Child Relational Problem".<ref name="bernetw">{{cite journal|last1=Bernet|first1=William|last2=Wamboldt|first2=Marianne Z.|last3=Narrow|first3=William E.|title=Child Affected by Parental Relationship Distress|journal=Journal of the American Academy of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry|date=July 2016|volume=55|issue=7|pages=571–579|url=http://www.kenniscentrum-kjp.nl/app/webroot/files/tmpwebsite/Downloadables_trauma_en_kindermishandeling_bijlagen/Bernet_et_al._-_CAPRD_-_2016-07.pdf|accessdate=7 October 2017|doi=10.1016/j.jaac.2016.04.018|pmid=27343884}}</ref> For example, the child's perception of an alienated parent "may include negative attributions of the other's intentions, hostility toward or scapegoating of the other (parent), and unwarranted feelings of estrangement".<ref>Kay, B. (2013). [http://fullcomment.nationalpost.com/2013/05/23/barbara-kay-teaching-children-to-hate-the-ex/ Barbara Kay: Teaching children to hate the ex] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130616033355/http://fullcomment.nationalpost.com/2013/05/23/barbara-kay-teaching-children-to-hate-the-ex/ |date=2013-06-16 }}. National Post, May 23, 2013.</ref><ref>Franklin, R. (2013). [https://www.nationalparentsorganization.org/recent-articles?id=20972 Limited Definition of parental alienation syndrome included in the DSM-V.] National Parent's Organization, May 26, 2013.</ref>
===Courts=== In a survey at the Association of Family and Conciliation Courts in 2010, 98% of the 300 respondents agreed with the question, "Do you think that some children are manipulated by one parent to irrationally and unjustifiably reject the other parent?".<ref name=":1">Lorandos, D., W. Bernet and S.R. Sauber (2013). Overview of Parental Alienation. In {{cite book|last1=Lorandos|first1=Demosthenes|last2=Bernet|first2=William|last3=Sauber|first3=S. Richard|title=Parental Alienation: The Handbook for Mental Health and Legal Professionals|date=2013|publisher=Charles C Thomas Publisher|isbn=978-0398087500|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mNfCCAAAQBAJ|accessdate=1 October 2017}}</ref> However, parental alienation refers not to the acts of manipulation, but rather to the child's rejection of a parent that results from alienating behavior.
Some courts recognize parental alienation as a form of child abuse with long-term effects and serious outcomes for the child. Some jurisdictions, including Brazil<ref>{{cite web|title=Brazil: Parental Alienation Criminalized|url=https://www.loc.gov/law/foreign-news/article/brazil-parental-alienation-criminalized/|website=Library of Congress|accessdate=7 October 2017|date=2 September 2010}}</ref> and Mexico, have enacted parental alienation as a criminal offense.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hill|first1=Amelia|title=Programme aims to help people affected by 'parental alienation'|url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/14/programme-aims-to-help-people-affected-by-parental-alienation|accessdate=7 October 2017|publisher=The Guardian|date=14 July 2016}}</ref> Other jurisdictions may suspend child support in cases where parental alienation occurs. For example, in New York, in ''Matter of Robert Coull v. Pamela Rottman'', No. 2014-01516, 2015 N.Y. App. Div. LEXIS 6611 (September 2, 2015), where the father was prevented from seeing his son by the child's mother through a "pattern of alienation", child support was suspended.<ref>{{ cite news | title=Father Not Obligated to Pay Child Support, Panel Finds | author=Denney, Andrew | publisher=New York Law Journal | date=9 September 2015 | url=http://www.newyorklawjournal.com/id=1202736637831/Father-Not-Obligated-to-Pay-Child-Support-Panel-Finds }}</ref> Some United States courts have also tried to address the issue through mandated reunification therapy; but no federal or state laws regulating parental alienation currently exist in the United States<ref>[http://www.wkfamilylaw.com/parental-alienation-crime/], "Should Parental Alienation Be A Crime?" - Wallin & Klarich Family Law</ref> Due to the nature of allegations of parental alienation, many courts require that a qualified expert witness testify in support of allegations of parental alienation or in association with any allegation that a parent has a mental health disorder.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Novotney|first1=Amy|title=Custody collaborations|journal=Monitor on Psychology|date=July 2008|volume=39|issue=7|page=48|url=http://www.apa.org/monitor/2008/07-08/child-custody.aspx|accessdate=7 October 2017}}</ref>
While states have broadly rejected parental alienation syndrome as a concept that may be presented in a child custody case, it remains possible to argue that parental alienation has occurred, and to demonstrate how a parent's alienating behaviors should be considered by a court when evaluating a custody case.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Larson|first1=Aaron|title=Parental Alienation in Child Custody Cases|url=https://www.expertlaw.com/library/child_custody/parental_alienation.html|website=ExpertLaw.com|accessdate=7 October 2017|date=24 February 2016}}</ref> Behaviors that result in parental alienation may reflect other mental health disorders, both on the part of the alienating parent and the alienated parent, that may be relevant to a custody determination.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Kelly|first1=Joan B.|last2=Johnston|first2=Janet R.|title=The Alienated Child: A Reformulation of Parental Alienation Syndrome|journal=Family Court Review|date=July 2001|volume=39|issue=3|pages=249–266|doi=10.1111/j.174-1617.2001.tb00609.x}}</ref> The behavior of the alienated child may also be a relevant factor.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Baker|first1=Amy J.L.|last2=Eichler|first2=Amy|title=The Linkage Between Parental Alienation Behaviors and Child Alienation|journal=Journal of Divorce and Remarriage|date=2016|volume=57|issue=7|pages=475–484|doi=10.1080/10502556.2016.1220285}}</ref>
